loc_desc:
Residents of this house in the 1930s reportedly heard extremely loud shrieks from somewhere inside the house. 
			They tolerated it until 1956 when an exorcism was performed. In 1980 the haunt returned sometimes to scribble ghostly writing on the walls.
address: 319 S. Fifth W. Missoula, MT United States

loc_desc:
Currently under construction as a new hotel. When it was formerly a department store staff reported sighting the apparition of a mustachioed man in a plaid, 
			flannel shirt and overalls.
address: 105 North Higgins Avenue Missoula, MT United States

loc_desc: This historic saloon was built in 1883, and is said to be haunted by a trio of cowboys, who have been known to engage staff and diners in conversation.
address: 337 North Higgins Avenue Missoula, MT United States

loc_desc: This theater is said to be haunted by poltergeist with a taste for theatrics.
address: 200 N Adams St Missoula, Mt 59802 United States

loc_desc: A ghost of a female student haunts Brantley Hall. She committed suicide after her family lost their ranch in the stock market crash of 1929. It is said a whole class haunts Jeanette Rankin Hall. In the Main Hall, unexplained screams have been heard, and in the University Theater lives a ghost dog, a girl who was murdered, and a theater patron.
address: 32 Campus Dr Missoula, Mt 59812 United States

loc_desc: Built in 1928 this hotel is haunted by up to three apparitions. Guest have seen a woman in a Victorian gown, a gold miner known by the staff as Jack, and a group of children who haunt the upstairs corridor.
address: 101 Sleepy Hollows Lane Lincoln, MT United States
